data.description: About InvescoAs one of the world’s leading independent global investment firms, Invesco is dedicated to rethinking possibilities for our clients. By delivering the combined power of our distinctive investment management capabilities, we provide a wide range of investment strategies and vehicles to our clients around the world. If you're looking for challenging work, intelligent colleagues, and exposure across a global footprint, come explore your potential at Invesco.What’s in it for you?Our people are at the very core of our success. Invesco employees get more out of life through our benefit and perk offerings including: Company networking events with other internsPeer Sponsor Program Leadership Connection seriesVirtual Lunch and LearnsInvesco Cares volunteer eventsComplimentary coffee and snacks401(K) matching of 100% up to the first 6% with a discretionary supplemental contribution Job DescriptionETF Product Development Summer Internship – Early Careers OverviewReady to make your mark in the world of asset management? Spend an unforgettable summer at Invesco alongside a select group of driven students. Our 10-week Summer Internship Program, kicking off in June 2026, offers you the opportunity to delve into the dynamic world of client services within a global investment firm. You’ll learn from seasoned professionals, gain hands-on experience, and build connections that will last a lifetime.As part of our Summer Internship Program cohort, you’ll participate in orientation, networking events, development workshops, and volunteer activities. You’ll work side by side with talented teams to learn about the business and contribute to meaningful initiatives.As an ETF Product Development Intern, you’ll play an active role in driving the growth of Invesco’s ETF business. You’ll work closely with the ETF Product Strategy & Research teams, applying your analytical skills to tackle real-world challenges and advance key strategic priorities for ETFs and other innovative investment products.This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain cross-functional exposure and you’ll collaborate with multiple businesses, learn how ETFs shape the future of investing, and contribute to projects that make a tangible impact. If you’re curious, analytical, and excited about the fast-paced world of exchange-traded funds, this is the perfect place to start.Here’s the best part: crush your internship, and you could be eligible for a full-time offer to join our Early Career Program after graduation!What you’ll doResearch & Analysis: Help create and update product and market outlook materials by conducting research and analysis.Competitive Insights: Support product development by analyzing the ETF competitive landscape and identifying trends.Sales Support: Work with Product Strategists to provide analytical insights that respond to internal sales inquiries.Reporting & Trend Analysis: Run internal reports, spot key trends, and summarize findings for senior leaders.Collaboration with Index Providers: Coordinate data analysis to support new product ideas and innovation.Project Variety: Contribute to ad hoc projects and assist with U.S. ETF product launches and updates.What you getCareer Launchpad – Build real-world skills and set the foundation for a future at Invesco—and beyondYour Own Mentor – Get paired with a mentor to guide your experience and support your growthIntern Community – Join a crew of fellow interns to collaborate, share ideas, and get to know—both in and out of the office. Pathway to Future Opportunities – Nail your internship, and you could be eligible for a full-time offer to join our Early Career Program after graduation! Real Work, Real Impact – Tackle meaningful projects and gain insight into client services at a global investment firmMinimum Qualifications Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program and be a rising Junior graduating by summer of 2027 Minimum GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale Proficiency in Excel (e.g., pivot tables, advanced functions) and PowerPointAnalytical mindset with attention to detail and a structured approach to problem-solvingGenuine interest in financial markets, asset management, and ETFsExceptional written and verbal communication skillsStrong organizational abilities, leadership qualities, and interpersonal skillsAbility to thrive in a collaborative team environmentHighly self-motivated, proactive, and goal-orientedMust be able to work in one of Invesco’s offices where the program is available Preferred QualificationsFamiliarity with programming languages such as R, Python, or VBA is a plusExperience with data visualization tools like Power BI or TableauUnderstanding of AI applications (e.g., chatbots, predictive analytics)Compensation for this position is $35/hour.Full Time / Part TimeFull timeWorker TypeStudent/Intern (Fixed Term)Job Exempt (Yes / No)NoWorkplace ModelPursuant to Invesco’s Workplace Policy, employees are expected to comply with the firm’s most current workplace model, which as of October 1, 2025, includes spending at least four full days each week working in an Invesco office. This reflects our belief that spending time together in the office helps us build stronger relationships, collaborate more easily, and support each other’s growth and development.The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.Invesco's culture of inclusivity and its commitment to diversity in the workplace are demonstrated through our people practices. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, or veteran status. Our equal opportunity employment efforts comply with all applicable U.S. state and federal laws governing non-discrimination in employment.
